references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: Which CAA Part contains definitions and abbreviations of terms used in other parts?
What is the definition of an aircraft?
questions.answer: Any machine that can derive support in the atmosphere from the reactions of the air, otherwise than by the reactions of the air against the surface of the earth.

questions.question: Give three examples of aircraft categories.
questions.answer: Possible answers: aeroplane, balloon, glider, hang glider, helicopter, microlight.

references.text: CAR Part 1 (Aircraft category and category of aircraft)

questions.question: How is 'Approved' defined by CAA Part 1, unless it's used with reference to another person?
questions.answer: Approved in writing by the Director.

questions.question: Which certificate is the flight manual specifically associated with?
CAR Part 1 defines the flight manual as containing __________ within which the aircraft may be considered airworthy, as well as what other information?
questions.answer: Limitations. Instructions and information necessary to the flight crew members for the safe operation of the aircraft.

questions.question: Does the definition of glider in CAR Part 1 include a powered glider while the engine is operating?
questions.answer: Yes, 'includes a powered glider whether the engines are operating or not'.

questions.question: According to CAR Part 1, a helicopter means a rotorcraft incorporating one or more ________ ________ ________.
Does the CAR Part 1 definition for maintenance include modifications?
What is the maximum number of people a microlight can carry legally?
How does CAR Part 1 define Operate, in relation to an aircraft?
questions.answer: Fly or use the aircraft, or cause or permit the aircraft to fly, be used, or be in any place, whether or not the person is present with the aircraft.
